intro: Hieracium capnotrichoidiceps, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
